title: What's the next big thing on youtube? - Quora

response.answer_text: The next big thing on YouTube is opportunism. A lot of people would say that this thing already is extremely predominant on the site, as demonstrated by the clickbait, but I perceive this transition to opportunism as a work in progress and I wouldn’t immediately place opportunism and clickbait next to each other. Instead, I would place drama and opportunism right next to each other. There are other people answering this question who are attributing witchhunting and ‘cyberbullying’ to be trends. However, I feel like this merely allude into the large scheme of YouTube nonsense. The site’s integrity has declined over the years, and major YouTubers have been quick to attribute Google / YouTube management to the decline. However, in all sincerity, the cause of YouTube’s decline is not inherently related to the bad copyright system or its priority metrics, but the fact that the quality of content isn’t even good or indicative of talent. This could turn into a heated debate, but I want one person to tell me that the perpetual strain of drama, heated arguments, witchhunting, clickbait, and other varied themes isn’t the epitome of opportunism. These otherwise obsolete kids seek attention, and they get it through these mediums. For that reason, I feel like my previous line about the ‘quality of content’ will only continue to be validated as YouTube’s community continues to fall of its rocker. I wrote a little bit more about this here, where I explain why YouTube has transitioned from ‘video community’ to ‘the front page of Internet drama.’ So, all that said: there’s nothing YouTube can do to control the quality of content on their platform. But you know what they could do instead? Ban all the morons.
